Experience Account Manager Cisco July 2015  – Present (2 months) Copenhagen Area, Capital Region, Denmark As Account Manager, I engage with customer executive leaders to discuss business relevant solutions and articulate advantages relative to business outcomes within Public Sector. In my role, I need to demonstrate knowledge of working with complex technical accounts coupled with the ability to negotiate solutions with peers, partners and customers using a Win/Win philosophy for success. 
 
As Account Manager, I need to possess a keen ability to position "end to end" solutions and articulate primary vendor strategies with customer executives within a diverse set of key accounts, including Municipal Government and Education. This position requires building executive relationships inside and outside of IT to relate Cisco’s impact to customer business imperatives. The knowledge of running a sales territory includes forecasting, quota attainment, sales presentations, account planning and relationship mapping. 
 
The role requires me to have 
-Strong collaboration skills and relationships with vendor ecosystem 
-Strong skills in prospecting, replacing a competitive incumbent, and protecting the installed base 
-Demonstrated knowledge of a process for managing a large territory including pipeline development and partner engagement 
-Operational excellence in forecasting, exceeding quota, account planning and presentation skills 
- Ability to deliver business value to the account and build on customer relationships Virtual Sales Account Manager Cisco November 2013  –  July 2015  (1 year 9 months) Denmark As Virtual Sales Account Manager (VSAM) I am responsible for achieving quarterly and  
annual goals by managing the Danish Education market, and by building direct relationships with end users and Cisco channel partners. I work closely with and leverage the selected Cisco channel partners to maximize the revenue opportunities within the Danish Education market. When working directly I provide counseling and consulting advice about IT products and solutions to +100 educational institutions in Denmark. Associate Sales Representative Cisco Systems July 2013  –  July 2014  (1 year 1 month) Amsterdam, Netherlands The Cisco Sales Associates Program (CSAP) is one of the most highly coveted early-in-career development programs designed specifically for top university graduates who aspire to become our next generation of sales leaders at Cisco. This year long program provides world class, hands-on educational and experiential training that will prepare our Associate Sales Representatives (ASR) and Associate Systems Engineers (ASE) to become successful Account Managers and System Engineers in the Cisco Sales Organization. Coloplast Master Thesis Programme Coloplast January 2013  –  July 2013  (7 months) Humlebæk, Denmark A Master Thesis Programme launched by Coloplast is the only programme of its kind for business students in Denmark. 
 
As part of the programme we were give our own office space, laptop, and full access to Coloplast data writing our thesis about Coloplast's capital structure. 
 
The thesis received the highest possible grade (12 on the Danish scale), and one month after, when Coloplast announced its strategy for the new fiscal you, the company chose follow the recommendations the thesis had led to. Analyst Deloitte Corporate Finance January 2011  –  June 2013  (2 years 6 months) Copenhagen Area, Denmark Deloitte Corporate Finance provides M&A advisory services for sell-side, buy-side and divesture assignments as well as integrated IPO advisory services. As part of Deloitte the corporate finance team can access in-house experts within fields such as tax, transaction- and valuation services and therefore provide a comprehensive service for our clients. Being part of Deloitte also provides access to Deloitte consultants globally. Student President of the Study Board for B.Sc in Economic and Business Administration at CBS Copenhagen Business School September 2008  –  December 2011  (3 years 4 months) Volunteer position where I represented 1500+ students. I had influence and voted on matters concerning the educational structure and student experience. I was involved when the new reform for the B.Sc. structure was designed. Student Instructor Copenhagen Business School October 2009  –  June 2010  (9 months) Lectured for two classes of 30 people each for two month. At the same time I was responsible for preparing case studies for studets from other classes and assisting them in how to solve them. In total I was involved in 5 different programs at CBS. In some classes I was responsible of up to 80 students on my own. Including owners and other stakeholders analysis and assessments of the business from accounting data and other information and reflections on the corporate form, finance, management, etc. University of New South Wales Master of Science (M.Sc.),  Accounting and Finance 2012  – 2012 The Australian School of Business (ASB) is one of Australia’s leading business schools, with a global reputation for excellence in teaching and learning and an extensive range of top-ranking business degrees. 
 
ASB undergraduate, postgraduate and MBA programs are highly sought after in industry, which is the reason why the university is the number one choice for ambitious business students and professionals. 
 
The university provides outstanding business education for both Australian and international students, and its world-class research and education programs attract internationally renowned academics.  
 
ASB reputation is proven by the calibre of its students. ASB has a five star rating (Good Universities Guide, 2013) for graduate employment for both undergraduates and postgraduates, including getting a job, starting salaries and positive graduate outcomes. This means that its students are highly sought after in industry, government and not-for-profit sectors. Copenhagen Business School Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.),  Economics and Business Administration 2008  – 2011 The focus of B.Sc. Economics and Business Administration is the company and its economy - particularly how to mobilize funds and improve the company's financial results. The program looks in depth at all key topics and issues in economics . You learn how a company lives and breathes, how it hangs together and how it is operated. You work closely with the economic relationships, and how to strengthen the company's finances. At the same time, you work with the surrounding community, and what impact it has on the business. Finally, the involvement of the role employees and managers can play in an organization. In short, you work on the program at all parts of a company's finances, including relationships between employees, influence from the outside world and the company's ability to generate profits. University of Richmond Bachelor of Science (B.Sc.),  Economics and Business Administration 2010  – 2011 Considered one of the top undergraduate business schools in the US, the highly regarded faculty and high-tech facilities of the Robins School of Business are matched by its cutting edge academic programs - at once challenging and engaging, intensive and comprehensive. 
 
Rooted in the liberal arts and built on core curriculum exploring each of the functional areas of business, the programs of the Robins School of Business offer students an uncommon breadth and depth of knowledge, skills and experience that have combined to establish the Robins School of Business as one of the top undergraduate business schools. Midtfyns Gymnasium Upper Secondary School Leaving Examination (STX),  Mathematics 2004  – 2007 Midtfyns Gymnasium is an Upper Secondary School with about 500 students and 60 teachers. The school has an academically oriented general upper secondary program: the 3-year Upper Secondary School Leaving Examination (STX).  
 
The program prepares pupils for further studies and, at the same time, they develop the pupils' personal and general competence. The program aims at enhancing the pupils' independent and analytical skills as well as preparing them to become democratic and socially conscious citizens with a global outlook. The program comprises a wide range of both compulsory and optional subjects at different levels. The curriculum and examinations must follow national standards and are subject to external evaluation. Apart from subject-specific oral and written examinations, students must also prepare one or two major written assignments Copenhagen Business School M.Sc.,  Finance and Accounting 2011  – 2013 The program is designed to provide students with a solid knowledge of financial theory, financial accounting, management accounting, securities and capital markets as well as competence in practice to work with the company's economic, financial and accounting analytical issues viewed from internal business, ownership and other financial actors angles. 
 
The program's academic problems are centered on the company's funding and its use for investment and capital market's role in capital placement services and the pricing of financial instruments.
